main event: An unidentified object resembling a football was sighted near Howard, Kansas on January 6, 1950.
interesting points: The object's size was estimated to be between 30 to 60 feet long and bright silver in color., The object was traveling at an estimated speed of 300 to 500 miles per hour at approximately 2000 feet altitude., The sighting lasted less than two minutes before the object faded from view., No further reports of unusual aerial activity were found at local military bases., The weather conditions during the sighting were clear with visibility of 12 miles.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object, shaped like a football
witness description: Captain Robert E. Williams, 1st Lt Harold G. Beason, and Lt. (jg) W. C. Kincannon, all experienced military personnel.
